thread.title: Hundreds remain without power on Vancouver Island following heavy snowfall
thread.title_full: Hundreds remain without power on Vancouver Island following heavy snowfall

author: Mike Rivero
title: Hundreds remain without power on Vancouver Island following heavy snowfall
text:
CTV News Hundreds remain without power on Vancouver Island following heavy snowfall 
Snow fell across the island on Saturday, with 30 centimetres recorded in Port Alberni and 20 centimetres in Parksville. Feb 5, 2017 (CTV Vancouver Island) CTV Vancouver Island Published Sunday, February 5, 2017 11:00AM PST Last Updated Sunday, February 5, 2017 1:14PM PST 
Hundreds of people on Vancouver Island woke up without power Sunday morning caused by heavy snowfall over the past two days. 
More than 1,800 BC hydro customers were affected by the outages as of 10:30 a.m. 
Snow also led to trees and power lines coming down in Qualicum Beach. — Nick Acciavatti (@Dashwood6) February 5, 2017 
A snowfall warning remained in effect for East Vancouver Island. 
Environment Canada said an additional five to 10 centimetres was expected before the snow eased off later in the evening. 
Flurries fell across the island on Saturday, with 30 centimetres recorded in Port Alberni and 20 centimetres in Parksville, according to Environment Canada. 
Vancouver Island University kept all campuses and facilities closed due to extreme weather conditions. 
Harbour Air was operating on Sunday following cancellations on Friday and Saturday. #bcstorm stats for Courtenay for today: Snow: 8 inches or 20cms Times driveway cleared: 4 Legs hit by shovel: 1 Sore backs: 1 — Gord Kurbis (@CTVNewsGord) February 5, 2017 Only received a trace to 1cm of snow overnight even though it snowed on and off all night and is snowing now. #bcstorm @ECCCWeatherBC pic.twitter.com/yR3k3hsuk2
